nnetsauce.custom package¶

Submodules¶

nnetsauce.custom.custom module¶

Custom model

class nnetsauce.custom.custom.Custom(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, backend='cpu')¶

Bases: nnetsauce.base.base.Base

Custom model class derived from class Base

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

backend: str

“cpu” or “gpu” or “tpu”

nnetsauce.custom.customClassifier module¶

class nnetsauce.custom.customClassifier.CustomClassifier(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, backend='cpu')¶

Bases: nnetsauce.custom.custom.Custom, sklearn.base.ClassifierMixin

Custom Classification model

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

backend: str

“cpu” or “gpu” or “tpu”

fit(X, y, sample_weight=None, **kwargs)¶

Fit custom model to training data (X, y).

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_training_set or self.obj.fit

self: object

predict(X, **kwargs)¶

Predict test data X.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

model predictions: {array-like}

predict_proba(X, **kwargs)¶

Predict probabilities for test data X.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

probability estimates for test data: {array-like}

score(X, y, scoring=None, **kwargs)¶

Score the model on test set features X and response y.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values

scoring: str

must be in (‘explained_variance’, ‘neg_mean_absolute_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_log_error’, ‘neg_median_absolute_error’, ‘r2’)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to scoring functions

model scores: {array-like}

nnetsauce.custom.customRegressor module¶

class nnetsauce.custom.customRegressor.CustomRegressor(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, backend='cpu')¶

Bases: nnetsauce.custom.custom.Custom, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Custom Regression model

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

type_fit: str

‘regression’

backend: str

“cpu” or “gpu” or “tpu”

Fit custom model to training data (X, y).

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values.

self.cook_training_set or self.obj.fit

Predict test data X.

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to

self.cook_test_set

model predictions: {array-like}

score(X, y, scoring=None, **kwargs)¶

Score the model on test set features X and response y.

X: {array-like}, shape = [n_samples, n_features]

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

y: array-like, shape = [n_samples]

Target values

scoring: str

must be in (‘explained_variance’, ‘neg_mean_absolute_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_error’, ‘neg_mean_squared_log_error’, ‘neg_median_absolute_error’, ‘r2’)

**kwargs: additional parameters to be passed to scoring functions

model scores: {array-like}

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

backend: str

“cpu” or “gpu” or “tpu”

class nnetsauce.custom.CustomRegressor(obj, n_hidden_features=5, activation_name='relu', a=0.01, nodes_sim='sobol', bias=True, dropout=0, direct_link=True, n_clusters=2, cluster_encode=True, type_clust='kmeans', type_scaling=('std', 'std', 'std'), col_sample=1, row_sample=1, seed=123, backend='cpu')¶

Bases: nnetsauce.custom.custom.Custom, sklearn.base.RegressorMixin

Custom Regression model

obj: object

any object containing a method fit (obj.fit()) and a method predict (obj.predict())

n_hidden_features: int

number of nodes in the hidden layer

activation_name: str

activation function: ‘relu’, ‘tanh’, ‘sigmoid’, ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’

a: float

hyperparameter for ‘prelu’ or ‘elu’ activation function

nodes_sim: str

type of simulation for the nodes: ‘sobol’, ‘hammersley’, ‘halton’, ‘uniform’

bias: boolean

indicates if the hidden layer contains a bias term (True) or not (False)

dropout: float

regularization parameter; (random) percentage of nodes dropped out of the training

direct_link: boolean

indicates if the original predictors are included (True) in model’s fitting or not (False)

n_clusters: int
number of clusters for ‘kmeans’ or ‘gmm’ clustering (could be 0:

no clustering)

cluster_encode: bool

defines how the variable containing clusters is treated (default is one-hot) if False, then labels are used, without one-hot encoding

type_clust: str

type of clustering method: currently k-means (‘kmeans’) or Gaussian Mixture Model (‘gmm’)

type_scaling: a tuple of 3 strings

scaling methods for inputs, hidden layer, and clustering respectively (and when relevant). Currently available: standardization (‘std’) or MinMax scaling (‘minmax’)

col_sample: float

percentage of covariates randomly chosen for training

row_sample: float

percentage of rows chosen for training, by stratified bootstrapping

seed: int

reproducibility seed for nodes_sim==’uniform’

type_fit: str

‘regression’

backend: str

“cpu” or “gpu” or “tpu”

Training vectors, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features

Target values
